name: ParameterMirror
comment: A dart-mirrors.ParameterMirror reflects a Dart formal parameter declaration.

type.name: type
type.comment: A mirror on the type of this parameter.

isOptional.name: isOptional
isOptional.comment: Returns true if the reflectee is an optional parameter. Otherwise returns false.

isNamed.name: isNamed
isNamed.comment: Returns true if the reflectee is a named parameter. Otherwise returns false.

hasDefaultValue.name: hasDefaultValue
hasDefaultValue.comment: Returns true if the reflectee has explicitly declared a default value. Otherwise returns false.

defaultValue.name: defaultValue
defaultValue.comment: If this is a required parameter, returns null. Otherwise returns a mirror on the default value for this parameter. If no default is declared for an optional parameter, the default is null and a mirror on null is returned.

hashCode.name: hashCode
hashCode.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality operator ==. Other than that there are no guarantees about the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides dart-mirrors.ParameterMirror.hashCode it should override the equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

runtimeType.name: runtimeType
runtimeType.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

simpleName.name: simpleName
simpleName.comment:
The simple name for this Dart language entity.

The simple name is in most cases the the identifier name of the entity, such as 'method' for a method void method() {...} or 'mylibrary' for a library 'mylibrary'; declaration.

qualifiedName.name: qualifiedName
qualifiedName.comment:
The fully-qualified name for this Dart language entity.

This name is qualified by the name of the owner. For instance, the qualified name of a method 'method' in class 'Class' in library 'library' is 'library.Class.method'.

Returns a dart-core.Symbol constructed from a string representing the fully qualified name of the reflectee. Let o be the dart-mirrors.ParameterMirror.owner of this mirror, let r be the reflectee of this mirror, let p be the fully qualified name of the reflectee of o, and let s be the simple name of r computed by dart-mirrors.ParameterMirror.simpleName. The fully qualified name of r is the concatenation of p, '.', and s.

Because an isolate can contain more than one library with the same name (at different URIs), a fully-qualified name does not uniquely identify any language entity.

owner.name: owner
owner.comment:
A mirror on the owner of this Dart language entity. This is the declaration immediately surrounding the reflectee.

For a library, the owner is null. For a class declaration, typedef or top level function or variable, the owner is the enclosing library. For a mixin application S with M, the owner is the owner of M. For a constructor, the owner is the immediately enclosing class. For a method, instance variable or a static variable, the owner is the immediately enclosing class, unless the class is a mixin application S with M, in which case the owner is M. Note that M may be an invocation of a generic. For a parameter, local variable or local function the owner is the immediately enclosing function.

isPrivate.name: isPrivate
isPrivate.comment: Returns true if this declaration is considered private according to the Dart language specification. Always returns false if this declaration is a library. Otherwise return false.

isTopLevel.name: isTopLevel
isTopLevel.comment:
Is this declaration top-level?

This is defined to be equivalent to: mirror.owner != null && mirror.owner is LibraryMirror

location.name: location
location.comment:
The source location of this Dart language entity.

This operation is optional and may return null.

metadata.name: metadata
metadata.comment:
A list of the metadata associated with this declaration.

Let D be the declaration this mirror reflects. If D is decorated with annotations A1, ..., An where n > 0, then for each annotation Ai associated with D, 1 <= i <= n, let ci be the constant object specified by Ai. Then this method returns a list whose members are instance mirrors on c1, ..., cn. If no annotations are associated with D, then an empty list is returned.

If evaluating any of c1, ..., cn would cause a compilation error the effect is the same as if a non-reflective compilation error had been encountered.

type.name: type
type.comment: Returns a mirror on the type of the reflectee.

isStatic.name: isStatic
isStatic.comment:
Returns true if the reflectee is a static variable. Otherwise returns false.

For the purposes of the mirror library, top-level variables are implicitly declared static.

isFinal.name: isFinal
isFinal.comment: Returns true if the reflectee is a final variable. Otherwise returns false.

isConst.name: isConst
isConst.comment: Returns true if the reflectee is declared const. Otherwise returns false.

==.comment:
Returns true if this mirror is equal to dart-mirrors.ParameterMirror.==.other.

The equality holds if and only if (1) dart-mirrors.ParameterMirror.==.other is a mirror of the same kind and (2) simpleName == other.simpleName and owner == other.owner.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.

noSuchMethod.name: noSuchMethod
noSuchMethod.comment:
dart-mirrors.ParameterMirror.noSuchMethod is invoked when users invoke a non-existent method on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the invocation are passed to dart-mirrors.ParameterMirror.noSuchMethod in an dart-core.Invocation. If dart-mirrors.ParameterMirror.noSuchMethod returns a value, that value becomes the result of the original invocation.

The default behavior of dart-mirrors.ParameterMirror.noSuchMethod is to throw a dart-core.NoSuchMethodError.
